contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, it's sunny and temperatures have risen significantly nationwide.
The city of Gwangju in Gyeonggi-do Province recorded the highest temperature nationwide today, reaching 30.4 degrees. What's the weather looking like for the weekend?

Right, Conn-young. We're surely getting close to summer. Highs reached 27 degrees Celsius in the capital today, but it's going to get even hotter. Amid the stuffy heat, the UV radiation index will continue to stay at 'high' to 'very high' levels for the weekend, so please make sure to wear plenty of sunblock before you head out.

Sunny spells are expected in the morning with Seoul at 17 degrees, Gwangju at 18 and Daegu 16.

Daytime highs will reach up to 28 degrees in Seoul tomorrow. This is forecast to be the hottest day so far this year.

Meanwhile, some brief showers are in the forecast on Saturday night in Jeju. And temperature wise, highs will mostly hover around 25 degrees in the capital for next week. Another bout of rain is in store in the capital for next Tuesday.

For Korea's neighbors, there's a chance of thunderstorms for Beijing during the daytime.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Summer heat to continue over the weekend
Updated: 2020-05-29 17:01:04 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, it's shorts and T-shirt weather this afternoon with highs heading into the upper twenties in many regions, hovering a couple of notches higher than seasonal norms. It will feel more like mid July.

And what about the sunshine? UV levels will be very high nationwide while high temperatures and sunshine could send the ozone level into the 'bad' range in many regions, so be mindful of that.

What's more, a lack of wind could make it feel hotter than the actual temperature So with a protective face mask on, spending time outdoors in the middle of the day won't be comfortable.

The last weekend of May looks to be warm and sunny while Jeju will see light rain tomorrow night.

Looking ahead, temperatures will continue to go up and down but we'll surely notice warmer morning lows than this week.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Shorts and T-shirt weather this afternoon
Updated: 2020-05-29 07:32:43 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, those of us in the capital will notice a big warm up today but morning lows are similar to yesterday so expect big temperature gaps it's going to be a hot and sunny Friday.

Don't forget your sunscreen, UV levels will be very high so with a protective face mask on, spending time outdoors in the middle of the day won't be comfortable.

For a closer look at today's readings, we are beginning the day with similar morning lows to yesterday, Busan and Jeju at 16 degrees Celsius, Gyeongju at 13 degrees.

Blazing sunshine and a lack of wind should make it feel hotter than the actual temperature.. Daegu and Gwangju getting up to 29 degrees, Seoul, Gyeongju and Chuncheon at 27.

The warm and sunny trend continues into the weekend while Jeju will see light rain tomorrow night.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

contents.headline:
Big warm up today under full sunshine
Updated: 2020-05-29 06:05:09 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, there has been scattered showers in some inland regions but after these brief spells of rain, temperatures are forecasted to rise significantly. Tell us more.

Right, Conn-young. We saw sporadic rainfall today here in the capital during the daytime. As rainclouds have moved towards the east, there are some light showers in Gangwon-do and Gyeongsangbuk-do provinces. The amount of rain is about 5 to 10 millimeters but is expected to ease by the end of the day.

And with the official start to summer a little more than a month away, plenty of summer heat is poised to move in. Temperatures will rise significantly all across the nation starting tomorrow. Especially for the weekend, you can begin to prepare your summer apparel as highs will reach 28 degrees Celsius.

We can expect sunny skies for most parts of the nation. Seoul will kick off at 15 degrees, Daegu also 15 and Busan 16.

Daytime highs will be much higher than today's. Seoul will be 5 degrees higher at 27. Daegu will reach up to 28 degrees and Busan 23.

Clear spells are expected for the rest of the week on the Korean peninsula with no rain in forecast for the time being.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Showers in parts of inland regions tonight, higher daytime readings tomorrow
Updated: 2020-05-28 17:07:36 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, some areas will see a bit of rain. Those of us in the parts of northern regions, as well as Jeju will need an umbrella until after lunch. Meanwhile, light passing showers are also in store for Gyeongsangbuk-do Province from mid-afternoon into tonight.

Temperatures will vary today, Seoul and Busan will have lower daytime highs, but Daegu will continue to have summer-like warmth this afternoon. Jeju will also have a big rise in temperatures despite the rainfall.

The rest of the country will see highs similar to yesterday, Daejeon at 24 degrees Celsius, Gyeongju at 28 degrees this afternoon. After the rain lets up, we could see sunny skies return.

We'll notice a big rise in readings from tomorrow and the warming trend continues into the weekend under mostly sunny skies.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

Updated: 2020-05-28 07:32:51 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, it was a bright day for most regions under strong sunshine on Wednesday. For today, those us in the northern central regions, Jeolla-do Province and Jeju will need a small umbrella. Light passing showers are also in store for Gyeongsangbuk-do Province. Busan, Ulsan and Daegu will have another sunny day.

Rain affected regions will have cooler highs today, only 22 degrees in Seoul while Daegu will continue to have summer-like warmth this afternoon.

For a closer look at today's readings, morning lows are kicking off similar to slightly higher than Wednesday, ranging from 12 to 16 degrees.

After the rain lets up before mid afternoon, we could see sunny skies back. Seoul and Daejeon will see highs couple notches lower today, Jeju will be warmer at 26.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

contents.headline:
Rain and cooler readings in central northern regions
Updated: 2020-05-28 06:02:08 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, we had clear skies today with relatively good air quality, but I hear rain is back in store for us tomorrow? Tell us more.

Sure, Conn-young. For tomorrow morning, light showers are in forecast in Jeolla-do Province. In the daytime, we're going to see rainy spells in Gyeonggi-do and Gangwon-do provinces. The amount of rain is expected to be around 5 to 10 millimeters.

Air is circulating at a fairly fast rate and fine dust levels are to stay at level 'normal' nationwide tomorrow. But there will be thick layers of fog in the morning on the west coast, so please be extra careful out on the roads.

Temperatures will cool down for a bit tomorrow but will quickly rise back up again. A scorching heatwave will began to grip the peninsula starting on Friday. Please continue to watch out for wide temperature gaps.

Cloudy spells are expected in northern parts of the country, but areas in the south, including Daegu and Busan, will see plenty of sunshine.

Daytime highs for Seoul will be 22 degrees Celsius and Daegu 29.

For Korea's neighbors, Beijing will see scorching highs of 32 degrees tomorrow.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Good air quality… brief rain in central regions tomorrow
Updated: 2020-05-27 17:07:44 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, southern inland regions will have another day of summer-like weather with highs moving toward the high 20's, the rest of us will notice highs going a couple of notches higher at 24 degrees in Seoul.

The strong sunshine will make it feel warmer than the actual readings and expect very high UV levels nationwide. UV-blocking sunglasses and a wide-brimmed hat should protect your from the very strong rays.

Sunny skies and much warmer temperatures are in store by the end of the week. By Sunday, highs in Seoul could hit 29 degrees. But tomorrow will be breezy again for some regions, including Seoul due to rain.

Northern parts of Gangwon-do, Gyeonggi-do and Jeolla-do Provinces will see light rain during the day tomorrow so rain affected areas and surrounding regions will have cooler readings on Thursday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Sunny and warm nationwide
Updated: 2020-05-27 07:02:25 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, unlike the murky day we had yesterday in the upper regions, the entire country will enjoy clear blue skies today. A light jacket is a must though this morning, but highs will rise slightly higher than yesterday this afternoon.

A lot of afternoon sunshine will boost UV levels to very high levels nationwide. The sun can be strong enough to cause sunburn when unprotected skin is exposed for more than a few minutes. So be careful.

Checking on our readings for the day, morning lows are kicking off at similar levels to yesterday, Seoul and Chuncheon at 13 degrees, Jeju at 17 degrees.

It's going to be a very warm afternoon for Gyeongju and Daegu getting up to 27 and 28 degrees Celsius. Good to normal air quality nationwide as well.

Sunny skies and a warm spell will send temperatures well into the high twenties. Sunday's highs could hit 29 degrees.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
